page.title: 06EDUCATION
page.content: The school at High Ongar was started in February 1871. It was originally founded as a church school. The school later became a boarding school and is at present run by Essex County Council. In 1975 the old school was remodelled. An extension was built to include a hall, dining room, kitchen and two classrooms to accomodate 120 pupils. The school age population has gradually declined in the area and in 1985 there are 42 pupils on roll aged between 5 and 12 years. The staff consists of a Head teacher, 1 fulltime and 1 parttime teacher.A private fee paying school,serving a wider area than High Ongar is situated in Stondon Rd.It is known as the Parents National Education Union school.It was started 30 years ago by the present head.The roll of the school is 120 pupils between 3\ and 12 years.
